page.title: 11Coastal Protection
page.content: The coast between Weymouth and Bowleaze Cove is subject to attack by the sea.Every winter the beach road is closed when the high tides push tons of shingle over the wall and onto the road. At Overcombe the cliff is slowly falling into the sea. The end cottage in the old coastguard building has been damaged by this erosion. When Portland Breakwater was being built shiploads of stone were also dropped at the base of the cliffs here. Those same stones now form the reef just off the beach. Recently a new sea wall was built.The foundations were built very deep and a curve was added at the top. This makes the waves turn a somersault and return out to sea. The cliff was also faced with stone to try to hold it up. Matthew Flux
